name: Winter Sun
text:
The wind is in all four facets of bloom,/ Flow and weave, cold cheek/ With a warm temple./

These lines are inlets,/ Coves eroding caves./

A cicada emits electricity,/ Thrumming crackle./ A gust of reckless traffic./ My frame of reference is inverted./ I walk where Iâ€™d rather ramble./

A sense of life and lovely loss,/ Rotten rind and apple blossom./
